trigger: Constitutive overexpression of the <extra_id_0> L-selectin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene in fresh leukemic cells of adult T-cell leukemia that can be transactivated by human T-cell lymphotropic virus type 1 <extra_id_0> Tax <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .
<extra_id_0> L-selectin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is an adhesion molecule of the selectin family that mediates the initial step of leukocyte adhesion to vascular endothelium .
Upon cellular activation , expression of the <extra_id_0> L-selectin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene is downregulated at both the protein and mRNA levels .

To understand the mechanism of leukemic cell infiltration into organs , we studied the expression and regulation of <extra_id_0> L-selectin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA in fresh leukemic cells of adult T-cell leukemia ( ATL ) patients and investigated the response of the <extra_id_0> L-selectin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter to human T-cell lymphotropic virus type 1 ( HTLV-1 ) <extra_id_0> Tax <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , which is a viral transcriptional transactivator .
Flow cytometry showed that <extra_id_0> L-selectin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> was expressed on fresh ATL cells along with other activation antigens .
Northern blot analysis showed that ATL cells overexpressed that <extra_id_0> L-selectin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA and that the level was aberrantly upregulated after PMA stimulation .
Studies using in situ hybridization showed expression of the <extra_id_0> L-selectin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA in the infiltrating leukemic cells in the liver of two ATL patients .
Intravenous injection of a rat T-cell line that overexpresses <extra_id_0> L-selectin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> showed increased organ infiltration .
The induction of <extra_id_0> Tax <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression in JPX9 cells resulted in about a twofold increase in the mRNA expression levels compared with the basal level .

<extra_id_0> Chloramphenicol acetyltransferase <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> CAT <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) assay after transient cotransfection showed about a fivefold transactivation of the <extra_id_0> L-selectin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter by <extra_id_0> Tax <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

The serum level of the shed form of <extra_id_0> L-selectin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> was significantly increased in ATL patients ( mean +/- SD , 4 , 215.4 +/- 4 , 111 ng / mL ) compared with those of asymptomatic carriers and healthy blood donors ( mean +/- SD , 1 , 148.0 +/- 269.0 ng / mL and 991.9 +/- 224 ng / mL , respectively ) .

These results indicated that ATL cells constitutively overexpress the <extra_id_0> L-selectin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene that can be transactivated by HTLV-1 <extra_id_0> Tax <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

The overexpression of <extra_id_0> L-selectin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , as well as of inflammatory cytokines , by ATL cells may provide a basis for ATL cells to attach the vascular endothelium , leading to transmigration and organ infitration .
